remarks.p: The OSCAL Control SSP format can be used to describe the information typically specified in a FedRAMP system security plan. The root of the Control Catalog format is system_security_plan.
An XML Schema is provided for the OSCAL SSP XML model.

define-assembly.name: system-characteristics
define-assembly.description: Contains the characteristics of the system, such as its name, purpose, and security impact level.

define-assembly.name: description
define-assembly.description: A free-text description of the system.

define-assembly.name: system-information
define-assembly.description: Contains details about all types of information stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and NIST 800-60 information types.

define-assembly.name: designations
define-assembly.description: Used to enumerate all special information type designations that may be required by a specific organization or compliance regiem, such as privacy impact information (PII), or payment card information (PCI).

define-assembly.name: designation
define-assembly.description: Used when a specific organization or compliance regiem requires certain information types to be explicitly cited, such as privacy impact information (PII), or payment card information (PCI).

define-field.name: declaration
define-field.description: Identifies whether a specific designation applies to this system.

define-assembly.name: qualifiers
define-assembly.description: A list of questions about the system that contribute to the establishment of a designation, such as the FedRAMP privacy threshold analysis questions.

qualifier.question: Does the ISA collect, maintain, or share PII in any identifiable form?

define-assembly.name: qualifier
define-assembly.description: An individual questions about the system that contributes to the establishment of a designation, such as a FedRAMP privacy threshold analysis question.

qualifier.qual-question: Is there a Privacy Act System of Records Notice (SORN) for this ISA system?

define-field.name: qual-question
define-field.description: A question that must be answered about this system.

qualifier.qual-question: Is there a Privacy Act System of Records Notice (SORN) for this ISA system?

define-field.name: qual-response
define-field.description: The response to the question.

qualifier.qual-question: Is there a Privacy Act System of Records Notice (SORN) for this ISA system?

define-field.name: qual-notes
define-field.description: Additional information about the response to the question.

qualifier.qual-question: Is there a Privacy Act System of Records Notice (SORN) for this ISA system?

define-assembly.name: information-type
define-assembly.description: Contains details about one type of information stored, processed, or transmitted by the system, such as privacy information, and NIST 800-60 information types.

define-field.name: base
define-field.description: The prescribed base (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

define-field.name: selected
define-field.description: The selected (Confidentiality, Integrity, or Availability) security impact level.

define-field.name: adjustment-justification
define-field.description: If the selected security level is different from the base security level, this contains the justificaiton for the change.

define-assembly.name: leveraged-authorizations
define-assembly.description: All leveraged authorizations for this system.

define-assembly.name: leveraged-authorization
define-assembly.description: The details for a single leveraged authorization

define-field.name: leveraged-authorization-name
define-field.description: Name of the leveraged system.

define-field.name: leveraged-authorization-service-provider
define-field.description: Name of the service provider that manages the leveraged system.

define-field.name: leveraged-authorization-date-granted
define-field.description: The date the leveraged system received its authorization.

define-assembly.name: users
define-assembly.description: Provides all user roles.

define-assembly.name: role
define-assembly.description: Defining a role to be assigned to a party or agent

remarks.p: Permissible values to be determined closer to the application (e.g. by a receiving authority).

define-field.name: privilege
define-field.description: Identifies the type/level of system privilege for the role. For FedRAMP, the only valid values are "p" (Privileged), "np" (Non-Privileged), or "nla" (No Logical Access).

define-field.name: responsibility
define-field.description: Identifies the functions performed by the user role.

define-assembly.name: statistics
define-assembly.description: Provides a collection of statistics about users of the system.

remarks.p: To be validated as a natural number (integer >= 1)
To be validated as a natural number (integer >= 1)
To be validated as a natural number (integer >= 1)

define-assembly.name: system-implementation
define-assembly.description: Provides information as to how the system is implemented.

define-assembly.name: ports-protocols-services
define-assembly.description: A collection of the ports, protocols, and services used within the system.

define-assembly.name: service
define-assembly.description: A collection of information about an individual service within the system.

define-assembly.name: protocol
define-assembly.description: Information about the protocol used to provide a service.

remarks.p: To be validated as a natural number (integer >= 1)

define-field.name: purpose
define-field.description: Describes the purpose for the service within the system.

define-field.name: used-by
define-field.description: Identifies the types of system component that uses the service. One entry per

define-flag.name: interconnected
define-flag.description: Are their system interconnections? (Yes/No)

remarks.p: If the answer is "yes", there must be at least one interconnection element.

define-assembly.name: interconnection
define-assembly.description: Details on an individual system interconnection.

remarks.p: If there is at least one interconnecton element, the system-interconnections element should be "yes".

define-field.name: isa-authorization
define-field.description: Name of the individual who authorized the Interconnection Security Agreement (ISA).

define-field.name: isa-name
define-field.description: Title of the Interconnection Security Agreement (ISA).

define-field.name: isa-date
define-field.description: Date of the Interconnection Security Agreement (ISA).

remarks.p: Components may be products, services, APIs, policies, processes, plans, guidance, standards, or other tangible items that enable security.
The @type attribute indicates which of these component types is represented.
A group of components may be aggregated into a "capability", such as an account management capability that consists of an account management process, and an active directory product.
Capabilities are expressed using the same component structure, with the @type attribute indicating "capability", and the child-element "sub-component".
For products, services, and APIs, this is vendor information, model, version number and other product-related information, such as support details.
For policies, processes, plans, standards, and guidance, this is the authoring organization, document details (title, publication date, version), and related details.
For capabilities, this is the organization that defines and maintains the capability.
To be validated as a natural number (integer >= 1)

define-assembly.name: characteristics
define-assembly.description: Component characteristics, assets and configuration information

remarks.p: When context="specification", this describes all security relevant settings in the component.
When context="standard", this describes how to configure the component to meet a specific goal, such as compliance with FISMA Moderate, PCI, or GPRD.
When context="actual", or when no type is listed, this describes the actual configuration of the component within a specific system.

define-field.name: ip-address
define-field.description: Use the @type flag to deisgnate IPv4 or IPv6.

define-assembly.name: satisfaction
define-assembly.description: Describes how the indicated control is satisfied by this component

remarks.p: When context="specification", this describes how the control could be satisfied by the component.
When context="standard", this describes how the security control would be satisfied if the component was configured in accordance with the associted characteristics provisioning information.
When context="actual", or when no type is listed, this describes how the control is satisfied based on the component's actual deployment within a given system.

define-field.name: dns-name
define-field.description: If available, state the DNS name or URL of the inventory item. This can be left blank if one does not exist, or it is a dynamic field.

remarks.p: Required for physical or virtual machines, network components, and similar objects.

define-field.name: netbios-name
define-field.description: If available, state the NetBIOS name of the inventory item. This can be omitted if one does not exist, or it is a dynamic field.

define-field.name: mac-address
define-field.description: If available, state the MAC Address of the inventory item. This can be left blank if one does not exist, or it is a dynamic field.

remarks.p: If the @component-id flag is provided in the inventory-item element, this can be derived from the component information.
If the @component-id flag is provided in the inventory-item element, this can be derived from the component information.

define-field.name: location
define-field.description: Physical location of hardware. Could include Data Center ID, Cage#, Rack# or other meaningful location identifiers.

define-field.name: asset-type
define-field.description: Simple description of the asset's function (e.g., Router, Storage Array, DNS Server, etc.) Do not use vendor or product names here.

define-field.name: hardware-model
define-field.description: Model number of the hardware.

remarks.p: If the @component-id flag is provided in the inventory-item element, this can be derived from the component information.

define-field.name: authenticated-scan
define-field.description: Indicate whether this asset is planned for authenticated scanning.

remarks.p: Required for software that runs on a host-item, such as a web server or database application.
If the @component-id flag is provided in the inventory-item element, this can be derived from the component information.
If the @component-id flag is provided in the inventory-item element, this can be derived from the component information.
If the @component-id flag is provided in the inventory-item element, this can be derived from the component information.
If the @component-id flag is provided in the inventory-item element, this can be derived from the component information.

define-field.name: comments
define-field.description: Any additional information that could be useful to an auditor or reviewer.

define-field.name: serial-no
define-field.description: Product serial number or internal asset tag number.

define-field.name: network-id
define-field.description: Virtual LAN or Network ID.

define-field.name: asset-owner
define-field.description: The individual, title, or role who "owns" the asset on behalf of the organization.

define-field.name: asset-administrator
define-field.description: The individual, title, role, or team responsible for operating and maintaining the asset.

define-assembly.name: control
define-assembly.description: Information related to the implementation of an individual control.

define-assembly.name: set-param
define-assembly.description: Identifies the parameter that will be filled in by the enclosed value element.

define-field.name: value
define-field.description: The phrase or string that fills-in the parameter and completes the requirement statement.

define-assembly.name: control-response
define-assembly.description: Describes how a control is implemented.

define-assembly.name: references
define-assembly.description: A group of reference descriptions

define-assembly.name: ref
define-assembly.description: A reference, with one or more citations to standards, related documents, or other resources

define-field.name: citation
define-field.description: Citation of a resource

remarks.p: Semantics of any contents within citation are implicit, not encoded. To mitigate problems establishin matches with bibliograpical databases, it is recommended a canonical identifier such as a DOI be provided for any citation.

define-field.name: link
define-field.description: A line or paragraph with a hypertext link

remarks.p: Works like an HTML anchor (a) except this is a line-oriented (block) element.

define-flag.name: attachment-id
define-flag.description: Unique attachment identifier.

remarks.p: No mechanism is proposed to ensure that attachment-id values do not collide across different catalogs. Use profiling without merge to detect such clashes.

define-flag.name: component-id
define-flag.description: ID of a linked or imported component

remarks.p: In the context of an import statement, this identifies the id of a component to import, and is required.
In the context of an inventory item, this identifies a component related to the inventory item, and is optional.
A component, such as a web server, may be duplicated within the system, such as a cluster of web servers.
The web server component is defined once, but each instance of the web server must be listed in the inventory. Each instance points to the same web server component.

define-flag.name: control-id
define-flag.description: Pointer to a control, by its ID

remarks.p: May also address subcontrols.

define-flag.name: stmt-id
define-flag.description: Pointer to a speific requirement statement within a control.

remarks.p: May also address subcontrols.

define-flag.name: nist-id
define-flag.description: Pointer to the information type in NIST SP 800-60.

define-flag.name: poc-id
define-flag.description: Identifies the unique identifier for an individual, title, role, or team.

define-flag.name: param-id
define-flag.description: Points to a parameter within a control, to which the contained value will be assigned.

define-flag.name: ref-type
define-flag.description: Identifies the reference type, such as a law, standard, guidance.

define-flag.name: target
define-flag.description: Provides for an indication of a link target, by its label, when no ID is available

define-flag.name: filename
define-flag.description: Name of the file before it was converted to Base-64. This is the name that will be assigned to the file when converted back to binary.

define-flag.name: role-id
define-flag.description: In the context of a responsibility element, this points to a role in the users element responsible for this control

define-flag.name: class
define-flag.description: Identifies the property or object within the control; a semantic hint

remarks.p: Overloading this attribute with more than one value is permitted, but not recommended.

define-flag.name: context
define-flag.description: Context designates the context of information provided.

remarks.p: The @context flag indicates the component's "characteristics" and "satisfaction" elements.

define-flag.name: name
define-flag.description: Name allows the information to be named.

remarks.p: For service information, this is the name of the service.

define-flag.name: start
define-flag.description: Indicates the starting port number in a port range.

remarks.p: Should be a number within a permitted range

define-flag.name: end
define-flag.description: Indicates the ending port number in a port range.

remarks.p: Should be a number within a permitted range

define-flag.name: transport
define-flag.description: Indicates the transport type.

define-flag.name: type
define-flag.description: Type designates the type of information provided.

remarks.p: For information system ID, the @type flag indicates the organizaiton who issue the identifier.
For vendor, the @type flag indicates the type of ID provided in the @id flag, such as a DUNS, CAGE, or similar.
For ip-address, the @type flag indicates either "ipv4" or "ipv6".

define-flag.name: public
define-flag.description: Designates an asset as either publicly accessible (="yes") or not (="no").

define-flag.name: virtual
define-flag.description: Designates an asset as either virtual (="yes") or physical (="no").

define-assembly.name: metadata
define-assembly.description: Information describing the publication or availability of this document

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title under which this document is formally published

define-field.name: author
define-field.description: A named author

remarks.p: Note this information may be duplicative of information given in a party element with appropriate role-id flags, along with more a more complete structured listing. This element provides a value for display as well as an additional point of comparison.

define-field.name: publication-date
define-field.description: The official date of publication

define-field.name: version
define-field.description: Version information

define-flag.name: iso-date
define-flag.description: Please use YYYY-MM-DD syntax.

remarks.p: The syntax may be validated in back. The date given should presumably be the same as the (human-readable) date given above it (and such a discrepancy is also be detectable).

define-field.name: doc-id
define-field.description: Any sort of document identifier, name, code, path or other indicator of where and how this document may be located, compared or validated. Given appropriate qualification via its type and rel, this value may point to the same or another version of the document.

remarks.p: Flags rel and type can qualify the kind and use of document identifier, in particular whether the value is to be attributed to the given instance, or to another instance, source or resource.
Specific usage rules, nomenclatures and recognized file types e.g. DOIs, CMS locators, etc etc., may be defined at application level. The value of this field may also be a hash or check sum.

define-field.name: prop
define-field.description: A property associated with the document

remarks.p: Wherever permitted, a doc-id should be used in preference to this field when the property is a document identifer of any kind.

define-assembly.name: party
define-assembly.description: A responsible entity, either singular (an organization or person) or collective (multiple persons)

remarks.p: As contents one of org or person is required, or both; there may be only one org, but many persons.

Note that persons can also be indicated with organizational affiliations by using orgname inside person. Contact information in that case belongs to the person, not the organization: use org when an organization as such serves as a documented party.

define-assembly.name: person
define-assembly.description: A person, with contact information

define-assembly.name: org
define-assembly.description: An organization or legal entity (not a person), with contact information

define-field.name: person-id
define-field.description: An identifier for a person (such as an ORCID) using a designated scheme.

define-field.name: org-id
define-field.description: An identifier for an organization using a designated scheme.

define-assembly.name: hlink
define-assembly.description: A pointer to an external document with optional hash for verification

remarks.p: This is different from unstructured link, which makes no provision for a hash or formal title. It is also different from the element of the same name once proposed for HTML.

define-flag.name: rel
define-flag.description: Purpose of the link

define-flag.name: media-type
define-flag.description: Describes the media or MIME type of a linked resource

define-field.name: person-name
define-field.description: Full (legal) name of an individual

define-field.name: org-name
define-field.description: Full (legal) name of an organization

remarks.p: Only when this element is used directly within org can it be accepted of the name of the thing to which it is attached. This element may also be used directly on person to name an affiliated organization.

href can be used to provide external links or internal links to other elements. The sibling org-id element (similarly for affiliated organizations) can also be used to link (for example to organizations listed elsewhere as parties.)

define-field.name: short-name
define-field.description: A common name, short name or acronym

remarks.p: This element is not expected to be used to identify individual persons, but rather an organization or system.

define-assembly.name: address
define-assembly.description: A postal address

define-field.name: addr-line
define-field.description: A single line of an address

define-field.name: city
define-field.description: City, town or geographical region for mailing address

define-field.name: state
define-field.description: State, province or analogous geographical region for mailing address

define-field.name: postal-code
define-field.description: Postal or ZIP code for mailing address

define-field.name: country
define-field.description: Country for mailing address

define-field.name: email
define-field.description: Email address

define-field.name: phone
define-field.description: Contact number by telephone

define-field.name: url
define-field.description: URL for web site or Internet presence

define-assembly.name: notes
define-assembly.description: Any notes with further information

define-field.name: desc
define-field.description: A short description

define-assembly.name: resource
define-assembly.description: A resource to inform or authenticate the present document.

remarks.p: Typically this information item describes and points to a mirror or other (authoritative or informative) copy of a document, or of a resource helpful (necessary) for interpreting it, such as its metaschema or documentation. It may offer a (persistent) link to a best available version, or to an outdated version, as indicated by its rel.

define-field.name: hash
define-field.description: A document hash or other value subject to cryptographic authentication

remarks.p: When appearing as part of a resource (data object), the hash should apply to the referenced object.

define-flag.name: algorithm
define-flag.description: Method by which a hash is derived

remarks.p: One of the following is recognized: MD5, SHA-1, SHA-224, SHA-256, SHA-384, SHA-512, RIPEMD-160. See XML Security Algorithm Cross-Reference (W3C, April 2013) for more information.

define-flag.name: href
define-flag.description: A relative or absolute URI indicating a resource available on the Internet.

define-assembly.name: extra-meta
define-assembly.description: Container for (system-defined) metadata

define-assembly.name: meta-group
define-assembly.description: Custom- or application-defined annotated metadata.

define-field.name: meta
define-field.description: Any customized or specialized metadata value.

define-flag.name: term
define-flag.description: A classification (according to any schema or taxonomy) of a metadata value or set of values.

define-assembly.name: import
define-assembly.description: Makes information from an external component file available to this component file.

remarks.p: This is typically used when defining components of type="capability", to identify the individual components the form the larger capabiity.
This is also used for definining provision information, involving components from multiple sources.

define-assembly.name: include
define-assembly.description: Specifies which controls and subcontrols to include from the resource (source catalog) being imported

remarks.p: To be schema-valid, this element must contain either (but not both) a single all element, or a sequence of call elements.
If this element is not given, it is assumed to be present with contents all (qv); i.e., all controls are included by default, unless the include instruction calls controls specifically.

define-field.name: all
define-field.description: Include all controls from the imported resource (catalog)

remarks.p: This element provides an alternative to calling controls and subcontrols individually from a catalog. But this is also the default behavior when no include element is given in an import; so ordinarily one might not see this element unless it is for purposes of including its @with-subcontrols='yes'

define-field.name: call
define-field.description: The call element imports the component definition identified by the @component-id attribute in the external component file.

remarks.p: This is typically used when defining components of type="capability", to identify the individual components the form the larger capabiity.
This is also used for definining provision information, involving components from multiple sources.

define-flag.name: with-subcontrols
define-flag.description: Whether subcontrols should be implicitly included, if not called.
